h1: How Many Calories in a Bacon Slice?
assumptions: One standard slice of pan-fried pork bacon (about 8g cooked weight), crisp, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, cooking method, and curing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of cooked bacon has about 43 kcal, mostly from fat, with 3g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 43 kcal for a standard cooked pork bacon slice.
Yes, one slice has about 192 mg sodium due to curing.

faqs.q: How much fat in a bacon slice?
faqs.a: Around 3.3 g total fat, including 1.1 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect bacon calories?
faqs.a: Pan-frying adds minimal calories; oven-baking or microwaving is similar if no oil is used.
About 3 g protein per slice, making it a decent savory snack.
